 to join our growing Industrial & OT Cyber Security unit. This team provides cyber security assessments, technical verification and advisory services both onshore and offshore. You will be working on exciting customer projects in key industries including maritime, oil and gas, renewables, utilities and others.
   

  

 This role will offer you the opportunity to work alongside some of the most experienced specialists in the Industrial cyber security field. We aim to provide you with a fast-paced career that brings you opportunities to develop your competencies rapidly. We will invest in your career development, offering in-depth training and the chance to participate in industry-leading courses and projects.
   

  

**You will be based at one of our DNV offices in The Netherlands, Germany, France, Sweden and/or the United Kingdom.**
**Job Requirements**
* Experience with operational technologies such as Remote Terminal Units (RTUs), Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs), Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA software, and Distributed Control Systems (DCS) and SIS
* Experience with major industrial systems such as Emerson, Yokogawa, Honeywell, GE, ABB, Siemens etc.
* Fundamental understanding of IT and OT network communication protocols (For example: TCP/IP, UDP, OPC, IEC 101/104, Modbus, IEC 61850, WirelessHART, ISA100
* Active participation in design concepts and implementation strategies for various SIS, PLC and DCS systems to guarantee practical implementation of security standards
* Understanding of contemporary and legacy security technologies used within a particular domain, such as Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Diodes, SIEM
* Strong knowledge of networking technology (e.g. routers, switches, firewalls)
* Comprehend the customer’s business environment and suggest fit for OT security solutions
* Background in a CNI domain, e.g. transport, energy, utilities, defense or other heavy industry


**For More Information About The Position, Please Contact**
 Head of unit, Industrial and OT systems, Svante Einarsson at svante.einarsson@dnv.com
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* International working environment
* Exciting projects within critical sectors locally and internationally
* Competitive terms and conditions
* Flexible working hours and a focus on work/life balance
* Social events, sports and team building activities


 Equal Opportunity Statement: DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
 **“Power up DNV – refer from your network”**
**About You**
**What You Bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field
* Minimum of 10+ years’ work experience in Operational Technology Security
* Proven experience in performing control systems risk assessments, and security awareness training for systems operators, owners and vendors
* Knowledge of operational impact analysis workshops and technical trade-off studies against SCADA, PLC and DCS architectures, and associated industrial communication protocols
* Expertise in developing OT security programs, and securing OT network architecture
* Ability to perform presales activities (e.g. proposals, presales calls, RFP responses)
* CISSP, GICSP, CISM or CFSE/CFSP certification
* Fluent in English and at least one additional European language


**We Value**
* Ability to present technical design proposals and reports to customers and/or other senior engineering, management and government groups in clear, complete, concise and non–ambiguous terms
* Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills; ability to clearly communicate and have excellent consulting skills
* Ability to manage and mentor a small team of Security Consultants
* Ability to undertake and complete tasks independently, meet schedules and delivery timelines, and move swiftly from concepts and theory to action
* Ability to interact with high-profile clients
* Willingness to travel for approx. 20% of your time


 We work with clients that are related to critical infrastructure. A qualified candidate must be able to pass a screening background check.

title: SAP iXp Intern - Solution Advisory Intern
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

**About The SAP Internship Experience Program**
 The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.
   

  

**Three reasons to intern at SAP**
* Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
* Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
* Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


**What You’ll Do**
 Job Title: SAP iXp Intern - Solution Advisory Intern
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

 Expected Start Date: April 2025
   

  

 This is a part time (16 hours/week) engagement reporting to the Swedish Solution Advisory Manager. The student will focus on supporting activities related to Customer Advisory SAP Nordics.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 The main focus for this Internship is to support and lead the SAP Next-Gen 2025 fall program.
   

  

**About**
**SAP Next-Gen** 
 is a global community for students, universities, schools and educational partners, who are passionate about innovation and technology. Our community leverages more than 2,800 educational institutions in over 100 countries. Our goals are to:
   

  

* Stimulate learning around digital technologies, twenty-first century skills and business applications
* Enable research together with universities and organizations in the SAP ecosystem
* Inspire to innovate with SAP to create a meaningful impact on the world


 Secondary you will also support the ongoing SAP Swedish business
   

  

* Support with document preparation and communication from the solution advisory team
* Support selected field engagements on Demand Generation
* And other various ad hoc and administrative tasks. Reporting and Resourcing.


**What You Bring**
 We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Currently enrolled in an accredited university program.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and a talent for executing on a deadline and managing multiple internal stakeholders
* Excellent writing & communication skills - Fluent in English and Swedish, both oral and written
* Experienced user of MS Office.
* Team player
* Receptive to feedback
* Organized and able to work toward deadlines


**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 417813 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Student | Employment Type: Limited Full Time | Additional Locations: .

title: Head of Operations Nordics
Partnership Sales Lead
description:
Partnership Sales Manager
   

  

**IWG - Partnership Sales Lead**
 Are you ready to lead the charge and be at the forefront of our ambitious global expansion? Is hunting, pitching and prospecting second nature to you? Can you confidently agree high-value commercial deals with building owners? Is business development in your blood? And are you relentless in your pursuit of delivering results, with the determination and resilience to change the world of work?
   

  

 If yes, we need to talk.
   

  

**What We Can Do For You**
 You’re reading the right ad if you’re looking for:
   

  

* The most exciting growth opportunity in the world, where you’ll be challenged every day
* Excellent training, development and promotion opportunities
* A fantastic incentive scheme which can see you earn great commission and prizes.


 We know we can only succeed if we give all our people every opportunity to shine. It’s why so many of our most senior leaders started their careers in our centres. And it’s what made IWG the dominant global leader in the flexible-workspace industry.
   

  

**About IWG**
 IWG is the world’s leading flexible workspace provider - with the world’s most ambitious growth programme to open 30,000+ new centres over the next decade to complement our international network of 4,000+ tech-enabled, sustainable and inspiring flexible work centres. Across our multiple brands, including Regus, Spaces, HQ and Signature, we’re provide world-beating workplace solutions to over 80% of Fortune 500 companies, including Netflix, EY, Amazon and Uber, as well as to local small start-ups, entrepreneurs and emerging businesses.
   

  

**About You**
 You’ll need to be passionate about working in a high-growth sector and ready to play a leading role in disrupting the commercial real-estate industry. You’ll excel at growing your network rapidly and taking our proposition to them. And you’ll thrive on initiating and closing multiple high-value deals at pace driven by your tenacity and expertise.
   

  

 Whether pursuing your own leads or following up on centrally-driven enquiries, you’ll highlight what makes an IWG partnership so special. By ensuring prospective partners fully understand the value of our proposition, you’ll be doing much more than simply meeting sales targets. And thanks to your outstanding communications skills - primarily in your local language but also with a good level of English - you’ll be able to present a truly compelling narrative to large and small audiences alike.
   

  

 Most importantly though, you’ll have the right, can-do mindset: passion, curiosity, pride, drive and ownership. We’ll look after the rest.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 Join our team of over 200 Partnerships Sales Leaders and you’ll get to harness your entrepreneurial mindset, strong business and financial acumen, and commitment to achieving outstanding business development results as we add to the over 1,000 deals in 50+ countries closed in the past year alone.
   

  

 From one day to the next, you’ll get the chance to:
   

  

* Agree high-value deals to deliver inspiring new partner locations, leveraging your expertise to expand the IWG network in every town and city
* Hunt out exciting opportunities in commercial buildings of all types across your region, pitch for new partnership opportunities, convince partners to invest anywhere from £250k to £1m+ to develop a new IWG branded centre and close out deals quickly & effectively
* Showcase the value of the IWG partnership proposition to your network of B2B connections
* Source ambitious partners who match our growth goals and can help drive our rapid growth through building conversions, new development locations or competitor conversions
* Employ a dynamic and versatile approach to business development, tailoring it to our partners’ varying commercial needs and requirements
* Actively manage your pipeline of opportunities to drive each opportunity from initial contact, through detailed commercial negotiations, all the way to a signed commercial agreement.


**Carbon Neutral Workplaces**
 IWG’s purpose is to help everyone have a great day at work, while protecting people and the planet. We are proud to supply all our customers with carbon-neutral workplaces, and have a strong climate action plan in place to help us achieve our objective of Net Zero emissions by 2040.
   

  

**Leading Employer Award**
 IWG is proud to be the recipient of a Leading Employer Award in 2022, 2023 and 2024. Awarded exclusively to the top 1% of employers, the accolade is testament to our diverse global workforce and the role everyone plays in bringing our purpose, culture and values to life, every single day.
   

  

 Join us at https://careers.iwgplc.com/home

title: EMEA Marketing Manager
description:
Canonical is looking for regional marketing specialists who will be responsible for developing long-term marketing strategy and executing campaigns for EMEA across a diverse range of products and industries to support our growth strategy. This is a hands-on, multi-disciplinary and dynamic position, requiring close collaboration with the regional Sales Teams, the Partner & Alliances Teams, Product Teams, and other Marketing functions.
   

  

 The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. They prefer to work in an environment that emphasises ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. They love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.
   

  

 This role reports to the EMEA and Americas regional marketing team manager.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.*
**What your day will look like**
* Develop and execute go-to-market strategy for certain industries within the EMEA region
* Set relevant KPIs for lead generation, demand generation and brand awareness campaigns; monitor and improve them on a regular basis
* Build organic and paid campaigns from scratch including crafting strong messaging, and creating visual assets for emails, social media and paid ads in line with canonical's brand look & feel
* Own webinars and regional offline events at all stages from planning to execution including holistic pre- and post-event/webinar strategies, webinar set up, streaming
* Work with the CRM Team to attract, convert, engage and communicate with new and existing audiences
* Be fully responsible for the regional budget planning and execution constantly monitoring and adjusting it accordingly
* Collaborate extensively with regional Sales teams to get their insights and implement them to the regional marketing strategy


 We expect members of the Canonical marketing team to be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, product managers, sales representatives and executives.
   

  

 Read more about the marketing team
   

  

**What we are looking for in you**
* Experience in B2B marketing for enterprise IT products, SaaS experience
* Experience working with the EMEA market
* Excellent academic results, with Bachelor's or equivalent in Business, Marketing, or STEM
* Excellent verbal, written, presentation skills in English
* Hands-on mindset and ability to test various marketing assumptions attributing to scaling the most efficient ways of achieving positive marketing results
* Growth mindset - enthusiasm for challenges and work ethic with a 'can do' attitude
* Objectivity and openness to others' views while continuously building a positive team spirit
* Proven ability to prioritise and meet deadlines without sacrificing quality


**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Total Rewards Business Partner [MVH]
description:
**About Mars Veterinary Health:** 




  





 At Mars Veterinary Health (MVH), the world we want tomorrow is A Better World for Pets because we believe pets make the world a better place. A division of Mars Petcare, we are part of a diverse, global, family-owned company that’s committed to leveraging our size and scale to make a long-term, positive impact on people, pets, and the planet
 



 Today, Mars Veterinary Health is a purpose-driven team of more than 70,000 passionate, pet-loving Associates spanning preventive, general, specialty, and emergency veterinary care and diagnostics. We set a standard for high-quality care for more than 25 million pets each year across 2,500+ veterinary clinics and diagnostic labs worldwide. Together, we are dedicated to harnessing our combined knowledge, talent and resources to lead the veterinary profession in making A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS – and the people who care for them.
 



 If you’re looking for a varied role, working in a rapid, fast-moving environment and would like to contribute to our mission of improving pets’ lives, this could be for you.
 



  





**About the team:** 




  





 Come and join a business that is rapidly growing and forward thinking. We are looking for a Total Rewards (TR) Business Partner (BP) within our ‘center of excellence’ (COE) team, who will partner with our Business Units to drive transformational change. TR is one of the top priorities in the Mars Vet Health (MVH) people strategy and will influence our ability to attract, engage and retain talent. This role will be critical as we truly make an impact on the veterinary profession, as we are aiming to offer competitive and equitable pay and benefits in this industry and offer a leading associate experience. It will advance the profession by offering pay progression in line with career paths, it will contribute to the health and wellbeing of our associates by offering competitive benefits that make a real difference to our associates lives.
 



 This role will be part of a small COE team that supports over 20 Countries in MVH International (Europe, CIS and Asia), this specific role will predominately support our Northern European business units.
 



  





**Note : This role will be based from our Group Company AniCura and working for Mars Veterinary Health** 




  





**About AniCura** 




  





 AniCura is a family of well-known animal hospitals and clinics specialized in veterinary care for companion animals. AniCura provides modern, high-quality veterinary care for pets at over 500 practices in 15 European countries and creates peace of mind for pet owners through excellent access and patient safety. AniCura has a turnover of around $1B with the aspiration to expand business through a combination of organic growth and new hospital acquisitions. Every year, AniCura’s 12.000 passionate veterinary professionals attend to three million companion animal patients. Since 2018, AniCura has been a part of Mars Veterinary Health, a family-owned company focused on veterinary care.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




**Job Title:** 
 MVH International - Total Rewards Business Partner
 




**Department:** 
 People and Organization
 



**Reports To:** 
 MVH (Mars Veterinary Health) International Total Rewards Lead
 



**Location:** 
 Sweden / Netherlands / Germany [Hybrid working]
 



**Languages** 
 : Proficiency in English and any other European language is a plus.
 



**Contract:** 
 Full Time
 



**Employment Visa:** 
 Preference for Candidates with a Valid Work Permit
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  





**Business Partnering:** 



* Partner with the different countries to implement and execute new/revised compensation and benefits programs
* Assist with M&A activities linked to TR, support and manage the setup of new schemes, with new clinic acquisitions
* Ensure compliance and governance of all TR plans and programs including identifying risks and delivering corrective actions.
* Act as an escalation point for P&O managers for total rewards queries – subject matter expert
* Upskill/educate internal stakeholders in all areas of TR (philosophy, plans and practices)
* Manage 3rd party TR relationships
* Oversee the development of TR communications



**Compensation:** 



* Co-manage effective and efficient rewards programs, processes and implement the required technology solutions
* Perform job evaluations, market pricing and provide salary recommendations
* Proactively co-manage all compensation transition projects in the region – interpret salary data and perform analyses to ensure competitive positioning
* Assist in building and renewing pay ranges in multiple countries
* Report on external market trends to stakeholder groups, providing detailed insights as needed by the different units (eg: market compensation & benefits development, our competition landscape, key/top talent, critical skills…)



 Supervise the timely and effective administration of the annual merit cycles & variable pay planning processes
 



**Benefits:** 



* Co-manage benefit roadmaps with the different business units/countries
* Manage and provide insights on specific associate benefits
* Assist in design & implementation of inclusive and equitable benefit programs
* Support improvements in our current benefit offerings to ensure competitiveness
* Support global benefits governance and compliance
* Support business units with annual benefits renewals (partnering with our 3rd party partners)
* Develop communication tools to enhance associates understanding and knowledge of their benefits package



  





**Qualifications:** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in Human Resources, supporting a total rewards function
* Experience in service, retail or health industries preferred
* Extensive knowledge of job and pay framework methodologies
* Strong computer skills, PC with experience in Windows, Excel, PowerPoint and other applicable software
* Demonstrated analytic abilities and attention to detail
* Ability to prioritize business and customer needs
* Experience or ability to work in a ‘start-up’ environment where there are no/limited processes, systems, resources.
* Knowledge of change management
* High agility and resilience
* Strong written, oral and listening communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Detailed oriented and excellent organizational skills
* Ability to speak fluent English, other languages a plus
* Minimum qualification: University degree or equivalent, preferably in HR, Business
* Preferred qualification: Combination of education and experience preferred



  





**As a Person, We Believe You Are:** 




  





**Customer Focus:** 
 Ensures total rewards programs align with associate and business needs to enhance engagement.
 



**Drive for Results:** 
 Delivers effective and timely compensation and benefits solutions in a fast-paced environment.
 



**Integrity and Trust:** 
 Handles sensitive data with confidentiality, fostering trust and credibility.
 



**Problem Solving:** 
 Addresses complex total rewards challenges with innovative and practical solutions.
 



**Dealing with Ambiguity:** 
 Thrives in uncertain environments, adapting strategies to evolving business needs.
 



  





**Interested?** 




 Please contact Lekya Kanamarlapudi, Group Corporate Recruitment Partner who is happy to tell you more about this opportunity and the recruitment process. Or apply by submitting your resume through clicking the apply button below.
 



 AniCura is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds.

title: Senior D365 SCM Supply Chain Consultant
description:
Join our Nordic ERP team of talented professionals and contribute with your expertise to help organizations achieve operational excellence and drive successful digital transformations using Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP. We partner with some of the biggest companies across the world, working together to improve business outcomes. We help not only well-established organizations move into the digital era, but also support innovative start-ups as they build their businesses.
   

  

**We**
* Have a wide variety of interesting projects to work with both locally and globally
* Provide you with a dedicated Career Adviser to support you during your journey at Avanade and who works together with you to create a personal development plan
* Welcome you to a team of engaged and helpful co-workers
* Have a wide range of different benefits such as employee stock purchasing, flexible work arrangements, a commitment to diversity and inclusion
* Provide the opportunity to work for Microsoft's Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 tears in a row), with a wide variety of development and training opportunities (80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Have offices in the major Nordic cities, and we support flexible work locations.


**Come join us**
 ERP is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your client’s challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions through Microsoft Dynamics 365.
   

  

 This role provides the opportunity to work for the Microsoft 1 Partner, with an unrivalled focus on development, global opportunities as well as a dedicated career advisor to support you through your career progression.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Strong consulting skills and client-facing experience with an implementation partner
* You have a passion for learning along with good business sense and time management
* You know how to manage your clients’ expectations effectively
* You’ve likely achieved a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field
* At least one full-cycle implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O or Dynamics AX OR experience supporting Dynamics 365 F&O as a strong user within the Supply Chain modules
* Experience with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain module
* Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain Management end-user experience nice to have but not required
* Experience managing/leading teams both on and offshore is nice to have, but not required


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role:
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Convincing storyteller and engaging content creator


**What You'll Do**
 You will:
   

  

* Transform business requirements into a straightforward and technical model, and match processes to application requirements
* Prototype and configure processes in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O) to make sure the system works the way your client needs it to
* Run workshops with your clients, consultants, and client leaders to analyze and design solutions for any application, and handle gaps detected during prototyping
* Work with the technical team to make sure that your clients' needs are incorporated into the specifications and functions
* Create or evaluate a breakdown of your clients’ businesses processes so that you can identify and link functional and non-functional requirements
* Documents settings and prepare your clients to use the system
* Support testing the proposed system and train users


**Learn more**
 Apply today!
   

  

 To Learn more about Avanade Nordics, visit our home page.
   

  

 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

 Avanade Insights exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
   

  

 Inside Avanade explore what life is like working at Avanade
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

  

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


  

  

 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


  

  

 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Senior Consultant SAP MM & MP
description:
**ValueOne is looking for a Senior Consultant with expertise in SAP, more specifically in the MM & MP modules. The assignment should be filled as soon as possible and lasts until the end of the year, with the possibility of extension.** 




  





**The Role** 




  





 We are looking for a senior consultant with solid experience in SAP (S/4HANA) MM & PM (Logistics / Inventory Management) to support and enhance the standard functionalities for Core Logistics Modules, plan and drive integration activities, and lead business solution design meetings.
 



  





 Your main responsibilities:
 



  




* Enhance and maintain the standard functionalities of S/4HANA Core Logistics Modules (MM & PM).
* Coordinate and manage integration activities between SAP-MM and SAP-PM.
* Facilitate and lead business solution design meetings, ensuring the creation of detailed functional specifications.
* Oversee the design, configuration, testing, and deployment of SAP-system solutions for invoice processing, workflows, and archiving.
* Manage and control inventory storage and material movements, including goods receipts, goods issues, stock transfers, and physical inventory.



  





**Experience and Competencies** 




  





 We are looking for someone who has over ten years of experience in SAP implementation, with a strong background in designing, configuring, testing and deploying solutions for invoice processing, workflows and archiving. You should possess in-depth knowledge of SAP modules MM and PM. Additionally, experience in implementing integrations with third-party invoice management solutions, including writing functional specifications and verifying interfaces.
 



 Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is mandatory. To thrive in this position, you need excellent communication, editorial and teamwork skills. A flexible and problem-solving mindset is necessary, with a good ability to cooperate with different teams.
 



  





**Application** 




  





 We look forward to receiving your application. Feel free to contact Sofia Hellsten at +46 76-513 40 22 or 010 332 29 20 with any questions regarding the listed position. Please note that to apply for this position you need to be an EU citizen or have a valid Swedish working permit.
 



  





  





*ValueOne are specialists in supply chain management, purchasing, and logistics. We offer our customers services in three business areas: interim logistics and procurement consultants, recruitment of buyers and logisticians, as well as development of our customers’ supply chain operations in terms of strategies, models, methods, processes, structure, and competence.* 




*We can offer a variety of assignments at all levels within Supply Chain Management. As a consultant at ValueOne, you are part of a professional and enterprising team consisting of the leading consultants in purchasing and logistics. If you choose to join our team, you are offered:* 




  




* *A market salary, which you can influence yourself.Occupational pension.Health and care insurance.*
* *Health care allowance.*
* *Personal coaching and career advice.*
* *Network meetings with competent colleagues and Supply Chain professionals through recurring events and lectures.*
* *Competence development through world-leading individually tailored education and courses in Supply Chain thanks to our partnership with CIPS (www.cips.org).*

title: Financial Controller
description:
**Join Aarke's Finance Team as a Financial Controller in Stockholm!** 




  





 Are you a finance professional ready to take on a dynamic and impactful role? Do you have experience in financial controlling and/or accounting, and are looking for an opportunity to shape the financial foundation of a growing international company? If so, join us as our Financial Controller at Aarke and help drive the financial health and growth of our global organization!
 



  





  





**About Aarke** 




 Aarke is a fast-growing company specializing in designing and manufacturing premium home appliances. We are driven by exceptional engineering and design to enhance everyday routines making us a real challenger in the premium kitchen appliance category. Our vibrant Stockholm head office is a hub of creativity, innovation, and collaboration with 50+ people across all departments.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




 As a Financial Controller, you will be a key player in Aarke’s Finance Team, responsible for overseeing the financial operations of our USA entity while contributing to broader financial and group accounting tasks for the Aarke Group. You work closely with the CFO and Head of Accounting where you lead a number of critical accounting and controlling processes, ensuring the integrity and efficiency of our financial practices across the organization.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 



  




* Lead Financial Operations for Aarke USA



  




* Oversee the financial reporting and controlling of our growing US entity, including monthly, quarterly, and annual financial processes.



  




* Set up and maintain effective financial workflows with local suppliers, customers and other partners.



  




* Review current and introduce new technical solutions where applicable.



  




* Group Accounting and Financial Control.



  




* Contribute to the group consolidation process, including intercompany reconciliations and financial alignment.



  




* Collaborate with the CFO on group financial reports, aligning the chart of accounts with the profit & loss, balance sheet, and cash flow statements.



  




* Drive improvements in the group’s monthly and annual closing processes.



  





 Broad Financial Responsibilities
 



  




* Collaborate with departments such as IT, Sales Operations and Logistics to ensure smooth financial data flows.



  




* Support the budget and forecast processes and follow-ups across the Aarke Group.



  




* With a holistic approach, active participating in contributing to optimizing accounting and financial systems and processes.



  





  





**Qualifications and Skills** 




 To excel in this role, we believe you bring:
 



  




* BSc degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or a related field.



  




* 2,5 to 5 years of relevant work experience from similar roles, audit & accounting firms such as “the big 4” or similar.



  




* High analytical skills and attention to detail, with a proactive problem-solving mindset.



  




* Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial reporting standards.



  




* Proficiency in financial tools and software is valuable. Aarke work with all-cloud locally relevant best-in-class financial software including group consolidation. You are eager to learn and take the steps needed to become an efficient super-user.



  




* You are strong with software and IT in general. You are able and willing to help yourself constantly learn and develop. You are likely very interested in BI and AI.



  




* You are not afraid to challenge existing workflows and methods to improve quality and/or efficiency within the finance function.



  




* Fluency in English, with strong communication and interpersonal skills and at least a moderate proficiency in Swedish.



  





  





**Why Join Aarke?** 



* **Career Growth:** 
 Aarke is expanding rapidly, offering opportunities for professional development and advancement. You are an aspiring finance professional looking to take the next step in your career towards roles like head of accounting, head of controlling or CFO.



  




* **Friendly and international environment:** 
 Collaborate with colleagues from diverse cultural and professional backgrounds. Enjoy a welcoming environment and social events also after-hours.



  




* **Sustainability:** 
 Contribute to our mission of creating eco-friendly, premium home appliances.



  




* **Modern Workspace:** 
 Work in our inspiring new office in the heart of Stockholm, with flexible work-from-home options (up to 2 days per week).



  




* **Competitive Compensation:** 
 Includes a market-competitive salary, private health insurance, and pension (tjänstepension).



  





  





**How to Apply** 




 If you’re ready to make an impact and contribute to Aarke’s exciting journey, submit your resume and cover letter via https://career.aarke.com/jobs. For questions about the role, contact Anna Korling, Chief People Officer, at anna@aarke.com.
 



  





 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Strategisk Rekryterare för tekniska profiler inom R&D
description:
Beskrivning
   

  

 Vår klient är en ledande aktör inom fordonsindustrin, med fokus på innovation och teknikutveckling. Just nu genomgår företaget en större omorganisation och förändringsresa, vilket gör detta till en spännande och dynamisk arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Som Talent Acquisition Specialist kommer du att ha en central roll i rekryteringsarbetet och bidra till företagets tillväxt genom att attrahera och rekrytera rätt kompetens.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Ansvara för och driva flera rekryteringsprocesser parallellt, i nära samarbete med rekryterande chefer.
* Rekrytera främst tekniska roller inom forskning och utveckling (R&D).
* Ge stöd och coachning till chefer och andra intressenter i rekryteringsprocessen.
* Arbeta med kontinuerliga förbättringar inom rekryteringsarbetet för R&D-teamet.
* Anpassa dig till förändringar och ny information i samband med företagets omorganisation.
* Hantera kommunikation med kandidater, chefer och kollegor på ett professionellt och effektivt sätt.


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Minst 2–3 års erfarenhet av rekrytering och Talent Acquisition.
* Kandidatexamen inom HR eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom rekrytering.
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift.
* Erfarenhet av att rekrytera tekniska roller är meriterande.
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat i en föränderlig miljö och hantera stress på ett bra sätt.


 Villkor
   

  

**För att öka dina chanser att gå vidare i processen, uppmanar vi dig att uppdatera ditt CV och tydligt lyfta fram hur du uppfyller de specifika kvalifikationerna och kompetenserna för tjänsten. Med hög konkurrens är det viktigt att visa på din relevanta erfarenhet och hur du kan bidra till just det uppdrag vi söker.**
 Du kommer att anställas som konsult hos Q och arbeta heltid. Tjänsten är placerad på vår klientföretags kontor i Södertälje, med möjlighet till distansarbete 2-3 dagar i veckan.
   

  

 Vi rekryterar löpande, så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Välkommen!
   

  

 Q har kollektivavtal och är medlem i branschorganisationen Almega samt i Svenskt Näringsliv. Företaget erbjuder interims- och rekryteringslösningar inom branscherna IT, teknik, administration, ekonomi, industri samt lager/logistik med personallösningar inom olika befattningsnivåer.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Södertälje | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/99 | Kontakt: Ayia Ahmed 013-4703905, | Publicerat: 2025-02-03 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-06

title: SAP S/4HANA Practice Lead
description:
Join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 as an experienced
 **SAP S/4HANA Practice Lead** 
 , where you'll take charge of delivering innovative SAP S/4HANA solutions, focusing on Sourcing & Procurement, Finance, Manufacturing, and Quality Management, while leading our growing team of consultants. This role is ideal for someone with extensive S/4HANA expertise and a passion for developing high-performing teams.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Project Delivery: Participate as aFunctional Consultant or Solutions Architect, leading the design, implementation, and optimization of SAP S/4HANA solutions to drive seamless business process integration
* Team Leadership & Development: Manage and mentor a team of SAP consultants, overseeing hiring, on-boarding, and performance management. Set development targets, provide regular feedback, and conduct annual performance reviews to ensure team growth
* People Management: Foster a positive team environment through communication, coaching, and team-building activities. Develop training plans and support ongoing skill development
* Resource & Project Management: Monitor team utilization, ensuring fair workload distribution and optimal resource planning. Lead team meetings and complete required administrative tasks (e.g. reports, annual reviews)
* Continuous Improvement: Stay current with SAP S/4HANA advancements and best practices, promoting innovation and growth within the team


**Your Skills And Experience**
* Extensive experience in SAP S/4HANA (Sourcing & Procurement, Finance, Manufacturing, Quality Management) as a Consultant, Solution Architect, or Project Manager
* Proven leadership experience, with a track record of managing and growing teams
* Strong ability to coach, develop, and inspire team members, ensuring both individual and team success
* Experience in performance management, including conducting yearly assessments, hiring, and making key team decisions
* Solution-oriented and positive hands-on mentality
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in Swedish and English (other languages are an advantage)
* Readiness travel if the role requires it


**Our Promise**
* Opportunities to advance your career and play a fundamental role in the expansion of our S/4HANA practice
* Competitive remuneration package (salary, bonus, social benefits, etc.)
* Hybrid working model and good work-life balance
* Opportunities to work on innovative, complex S/4HANA transformations across various industries
* Friendly and supportive team of SAP experts
* Environment of open communication, trust and regular feedback
* International company culture and minimal hierarchical structure with quick and effective decision-making processes


**Interested? Then, don't hesitate to apply!**
**This Is WE**
 Committed to innovation, since 1969 Westernacher Consulting operates worldwide, with more than 1000 consultants in Europe, Asia and the Americas. We provide global business and SAP consulting, serving medium to large sized enterprises striving for innovation, operational excellence and profitable, sustainable growth. Headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, Westernacher Consulting is the global leader in business process and technology innovation.
   

  

 Living, working, and operating in partnership. We are inquisitive, creative thinkers with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We question new ways of working, think differently and are willing to try out new approaches to create value and innovation for our customers. All of this makes us pioneers in our field and keeps us responsive, quality-focused and results-oriented.
   

  

 Westernacher is a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Controller NSV   Styrning och stöd
description:
Gillar du utveckling och förändring och vill arbeta med samhällsnyttiga och komplexa frågor? Följ då med vår controllerfunktion på en spännande resa mot ökad samordning och utvecklad ekonomistyrning. Vi söker en controller till Controllerenheten Närsjukvård, avdelningen Styrning och stöd inom Hälso-och sjukvårdsförvaltningen. Förvaltningen har en budget på drygt 89 miljarder kronor och här arbetar cirka 600 medarbetare.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter blir att tillsammans med övriga controllers och avtalshandläggare på enheten och inom förvaltningen:
   

  

* Delta i arbete med budget, prognoser, bokslut och uppföljning
* Göra ekonomiska kalkyler och analyser
* Utarbeta underlag inför och delta i avtalsförhandlingar och uppföljningsmöten
* Utarbeta underlag inför politiska beslut
* Medverka i arbetet med att utveckla ersättningsmodeller och uppföljningssystem


**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i rollen ser vi att du har en högskoleexamen med inriktning mot ekonomi och några års erfarenhet av budget-, prognos- och bokslutsarbete. Du är en van användare av IT-verktyg och databaser samt Excel. Arbetet kräver god analytisk- och initiativförmåga, där du är van att se samband och mönster vid analys av stora datamängder.
   

  

 Vi söker dig med mycket god samarbetsförmåga som har förmåga att skapa bra samarbetsklimat och relationer med externa och interna samarbetspartners. Som person är du självständig och resultatorienterad, du är drivande och tar egna initiativ. Du har god pedagogisk och kommunikativ förmåga och kan anpassa underlag och information till din målgrupp.
   

  

 Du har även god förmåga att skapa förutsättningar för kunskapsspridning och kompetensutveckling. Ett stort intresse av utvecklingsarbete och förmåga att se helhet och agera på delar i en komplex verksamhet är också av vikt.
   

  

 I rekryteringsprocessen kommer vi att lägga stort fokus på personliga egenskaper. Erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig sektor är meriterande.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Läs mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal här.
   

  

 Vi sitter i fina lokaler på Lindhagensgatan. Hit tar du dig enkelt med tunnelbana eller buss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev. Urval kan komma att ske löpande.
   

  

 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Janine Jemt, janine.jemt@regionstockholm.se
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen stödjer Region Stockholms politiska organisation för att invånarna i Stockholms län har tillgång till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt tandvård. Det innebär att förvaltningen beställer och följer upp hälso- och sjukvård och tandvård för 75 miljarder kronor årligen. Förvaltningen ansvarar också för kunskapsstyrningsorganisationen i Region Stockholm, samt en rad funktioner som är avgörande för hälso- och sjukvårdssystemet, såsom smittskydd, vårdhygien, kris- och katastrofberedskap. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
