title: ServiceNow Developers - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
*Are you a swedish speaking pro in ServiceNow and passionate about outstanding customer experience?*
 At Tietoevry Tech Services Sweden, we modernize our customers IT landscape to drive efficiency, agility, innovation and to realize their digital ambitions. Our customers are large Nordic organizations operating in various industries as well as in the public sector. Our aim is to become the market leader in the Nordics and the first choice for our customers’ business renewal. ServiceNow is one of the leading Enterprise Service Management platforms and a focus area for Tietoevry in the Nordic market. We are therefore now looking for
 **ServiceNow Developers** 
 to perform creative work with our customers.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Tech Services as a Servicenow developer:**
* You will work in DevOps model to implement/expand ServiceNow modules ITSM, HR, IRM for our customers
* Implement/modify integrations using REST API or Integration Hub
* Explain and present new ideas and solutions to our customers
* Analyze and resolve production issues around implemented solution based on ServiceNow
* Handle code migration from development to test to production instances of ServiceNow
* Support end users with queries around ServiceNow based implemented solution
* Be a part o a global team


**We offer you:**
 You will make your mark in meaningful projects (for example, developing solutions including ITSM and HR modules of ServiceNow integrating with 3rd party tools). We are a global team with Nordic heritage. With us, you will work with diverse team of experts in an inclusive environment. We also offer you flexibility and a good work-life balance. We will also offer ServiceNow trainings and conferences for you to get relevant certifications.
   

  

**We believe you to have:**
* Certification as a ServiceNow Administrator
* A few years of experience in ServiceNow developer/ support role
* Strong technical knowledge about ServiceNow ITSM, HR and/or IRM module
* Good Knowledge about ServiceNow On-Premise implementation
* Fluent in swedish and english


**It is meritarious if you also:**
* Are a Certified Implementation Specialist
* Prior exposure working with international teams located across Europe.


 As a person, we believe you to be communicative, keen to work in a global environment, collaborative and a problem solver.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Amit Ambre, amit.ambre@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Kravhantering för avancerade flygsystem - Linköping
description:
🚀
 **Gå med i vårt team på VIPAS AB!** 
 🚀
   

  

**Har du vad som krävs för att lyckas i den dynamiska IT-konsultbranschen?**
 VIPAS AB är ett växande företag som söker engagerade och drivna talanger till vårt nästa spännande projekt. Som en del av vårt team får du möjligheten att utvecklas, arbeta med innovativa lösningar och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.
   

  

 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Välkommen att bli en del av VIPAS AB!
   

  

**Om VIPAS**
 Föreställ dig en värld där din IT-struktur är sömlöst anpassad till dina affärsmål – effektiv, skalbar och innovativ. På VIPAS AB är det precis vad vi skapar.
   

  

 Som ett ledande IT-konsultföretag levererar vi skräddarsydda lösningar med den senaste tekniken, inklusive Java och Python. Vårt erfarna team inom mjukvaruutveckling, DevOps och systemarkitektur hjälper dig att navigera det moderna tekniklandskapet med trygghet och strategisk framåtblick.
   

  

 Oavsett om du behöver optimera befintliga system eller utveckla nästa generations digitala plattform, är vi din partner för långsiktig framgång. Låt oss ta din verksamhet till nästa nivå.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker en engagerad Stakeholder Requirement Manager till vår kund i Linköping. Uppdraget erbjuder dig en möjlighet att arbeta med avancerade system och kravhantering för några av världens mest komplexa produkter, som Gripen och dess stöd- och träningssystem.Om uppdraget.
   

  

 I denna roll blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med kravförvaltning och verifieringsrapportering, både internt och gentemot kunder samt den militära flyginspektionen (FLYGI). Du kommer att ingå i ett team om 7–8 personer och tillsammans säkerställer ni att kund- och myndighetskrav hanteras och rapporteras på ett strukturerat sätt.Arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:Kravhantering i databas samt framtagning och uppdatering av kravspecifikationer.
   

  

 Hantering av verifieringsinformation för produkt-, luftvärdighets- och kontraktskrav.
   

  

 Utveckling av metoder för verifieringsrapportering internt och till kunder och FLYGI.
   

  

 Stöttning av organisationen i kravrelaterade frågor.
   

  

 Administration av verifieringsrapporter och kommunikation med kunder och myndigheter.
   

  

 I rollen är du proaktiv, initiativtagande och bidrar till att upprätthålla ett positivt arbetsklimat i gruppen.
   

  

**Krav**
 För att lyckas i uppdraget ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Minst 3–5 års erfarenhet av kravhantering, systemutveckling eller arbete med databaser.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Erfarenhet av objekts- eller relationsdatabaser, exempelvis IBM Doors (meriterande).
* Goda kunskaper i Office-paketet, särskilt Word och Excel.
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat och lösningsorienterat i en komplex miljö.


 Särskilda krav:Säkerhetsklassning krävs innan start.
   

  

**Varför jobba hos oss?**
 VIPAS AB erbjuder attraktiva anställningspaket för IT-konsulter, i enlighet med Teknikföretagens (Almega) kollektivavtal. Att arbeta med oss innebär möjligheter inom olika branscher, vilket ger dig flexibilitet och möjligheter till utveckling. Om du är drivande och redo att anta nya utmaningar, är VIPAS familjen för dig!
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett innovativt team som driver framtiden inom telekom, fordon, detaljhandel och bank. Om du är redo att ta dig an utmanande projekt och växa i en banbrytande miljö, är detta möjligheten för dig!
   

  

**Ansök nu**
 Tveka inte att kontakta oss på
 **kumud@vipas.se**
**Observera:** 
 Ansök om du har
 **Svensk medborgarskap** 
 eller ett
 **arbetstillstånd.**
**Hur Ansöker Du**
 Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att skicka in sitt CV och personliga brev. Gå med oss och driv innovation på VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Observera att vi rekryterar löpande, vilket innebär att uppdraget kan stängas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Om du är intresserad rekommenderar vi att du ansöker omedelbart!

title: Senior Platform Engineer (.NET) - Remote
description:
Everything we do is powered by our customers! Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a connected experience that our customers anticipate, transforming marketing, merchandising, and operations with commerce tools designed to scale with fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by curiosity, creativity, and collaboration to power 5,000+ global brands.
   

  

 Driven by a customer-first mentality, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.
   

  

 Become a part of Maropost today and help shape the future of commerce!
   

  

  

  

**About The Position**
 As a Senior Platform Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing, maintaining, and optimizing our .NET-based applications. Your expertise in .NET development, code refactoring, and experience with both Linux and Windows environments will be essential. Additionally, your exposure to various open-source databases, cloud platforms like Azure and GCP, and experience with DevOps tooling will contribute to the success of our platform.
   

  

**The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET ( +/-2 hours)** 
 .
   

  

**What You'll Be Responsible For**
* Work with .NET code/framework to develop and maintain applications running on Windows machines.
* Refactor code and identify/resolve bugs to improve application performance and functionality.
* Utilize experience working on both Linux and Windows-based machines to ensure compatibility and smooth operation of applications.
* Analyze and upgrade core API microservices from .NET Core 3.1 to .NET 8, ensuring successful builds and addressing any potential errors during the upgrade process.
* Develop and maintain Windows services, ensuring their reliability and efficient operation.
* Refactor and develop efforts for upgrading the Backoffice application from the old ASP .NET Web Forms framework to a higher version, addressing code compatibility and functionality improvements.
* Collaborate with team members to analyze and assess the scope of refactoring and development efforts for upgrading applications using Microsoft Assistant tools and Microsoft Planner.
* Utilize experience with Azure and GCP to deploy and manage applications on cloud platforms, ensuring scalability and reliability.


**What You'll Bring To Maropost**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
* 8+ years in .NET development, with proficiency in working with .NET code/framework.
* Experience with code refactoring and bug fixing to improve application performance and functionality.
* Ability to work on both Linux and Windows-based machines.
* Exposure to various open-source databases for data storage and management.
* Experience working on different cloud platforms, primarily Azure and GCP.
* Deep understanding of Azure-based services and DevOps tooling for building and deploying .NET applications.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with team members.


**Preferred**
* 10+ years in .NET development, with proficiency in working with .NET code/framework.
* In-depth knowledge in architecting and optimizing large-scale .NET applications.
* Familiarity with distributed systems and message queuing systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes and writing YAML manifests for deployment and configuration management.
* Experience with monitoring and observability tools.
* Familiarity with network security concepts.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* 3+ years of experience in developing and maintaining Windows services for .NET applications.
* Hands-on experience of at least 3 years in designing and implementing backup and disaster recovery solutions for Windows-based environments.
* Proficiency of at least 3 years in writing and maintaining automation scripts for Windows-based infrastructure tasks.
* Previous involvement of at least 2 years in setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for .NET applications.
* Direct experience of at least 3 years with Windows system administration and troubleshooting.
* Practical knowledge of at least 2 years in managing Windows-based servers and services.
* Demonstrated experience of at least 2 years in configuring and utilizing monitoring and observability tools effectively in Windows environments.
* Proficient for at least 3 years in optimizing database performance through advanced indexing strategies, query optimization, and tuning methodologies in Windows-based databases.
* Previous exposure of at least 2 years to Windows-based distributed systems and message queuing systems.
* Hands-on experience of at least 2 years with Windows-based network security tools and concepts, including firewalls and intrusion detection/prevention systems.


 Equal Employment Opportunist:
   

  

 Maropost is deeply committed to promoting diversity, advancing equity and fostering a culture of inclusion. Therefore, we invite applications from marginalized and equity-seeking groups. Individuals seeking employment at Maropost are considered without regards to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or veteran status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please feel free to reach out to the recruitment team for any accommodation requests or questions.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Key Connectors
description:
**Why This Role Matters**
 The Key Connectors team is at the heart of Funnel's success—without them, Funnel wouldn’t be able to deliver the value our customers rely on!
   

  

 The Key Connectors are responsible for pulling data from our highest throughput marketing platforms into Funnel, making it accessible for analysis and enhancement. They work closely with our customers to understand their needs and continuously improve our product. The team also collaborates with teams across design, product, and technical support, where they play a key role in addressing technical product inquiries and ensuring everything runs smoothly.
   

  

**About The Engineering Team & Your Role**
 Our teams have clear ownership of their product areas, making daily decisions in close collaboration both within and across teams, within and across departments, as well as with stakeholders. We work in small, iterative cycles, experimenting, learning, and updating the product multiple times a day.
   

  

 The Key Connectors team focuses on seamlessly fetching marketing data from our highest volume and visibility sources like Meta and Google. We unify this data to ensure it’s readily accessible and actionable for marketers through the Funnel Data-Hub dashboard. With so many customers connected to these key connectors, we focus on robust, scalable designs.
   

  

 At Funnel, our engineers handle everything from designing system architecture to implementation, deploying and monitoring our services. We put our customers first and always strive to design products that address their needs and go above and beyond.
   

  

**Skills & Experience We’re Looking For**
* +5 years of working experience as a software developer.
* Enjoy programming in Python.
* Hands-on experience building API integrations between different platforms to ensure smooth data flow and functionality.
* Enjoy optimizing pipelines, anomaly investigation, and optimizing resource allocation.
* Experience working with agile methodologies and team-based workflows. You’re comfortable collaborating with fellow engineers, adapting to change, and keeping initiatives moving smoothly to completion.
* Experience in improving engineering practices and processes.
* Experience steering projects with many stakeholders.
* Familiar with test-driven development and writing clean, testable code to create reliable, high-quality software.
* An overall strong communicator and fluent English.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code in AWS.
* Excitement about Rust
* Familiarity with JavaScript/Typescript
* Integration and Regression Testing expertise
* DevOps experience


**What Makes You a Great Match for Funnel and the Key team**
* You’re comfortable with creating your own tasks as well as a clear backlog and tasks to work on
* You’re humble, open to feedback and hearing alternative ways of doing things.
* You’re driven to improve things and not settle with the status quo (e.g., when faced with the same support issue multiple times you try to solve the underlying problem).
* You’re pragmatic, preferring to make steady, incremental progress rather than wait for the perfect solution.
* You view challenges as opportunities and embrace learning.
* You follow engineering best practices and stay current with evolving technologies.
* You thrive in high visibility and high impact environments.
* You enjoy collaborating across teams, working with design, product, and customers to create great solutions. Collaboration is what sets Funnel apart.
* You’re happy working with support, interacting with other departments and customers when needed.


 Additional Information
   

  

 At this time, we can only consider applicants who are already located in
 **Stockholm** 
 and:
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship, or
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship and are currently living in Stockholm, or
* Have a valid Swedish work permit


**Benefits & Perks**
 We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits. → Take a look at our benefits here.
   

  

**Interview Process**
 We have a 4-step recruitment process for most roles → Get an overview of the steps here.
   

  

**Inclusiveness**
 Research shows that many candidates, especially women and individuals from underrepresented groups, may hesitate to apply for a role unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and your skills and experiences align, we strongly encourage you to apply. We’re interested in what you can bring, even if you don’t check every box.
   

  

**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: SAP Integration Engineer
description:
**Job ID: 26549**
 Would you like to take an active part in our journey to build the best future bank? This is a great opportunity for you as we are now looking for an SAP Integration Engineer to join our team of requirement engineering specialists.
   

  

 Your main responsibility is to bring value to our employees by being part of transformation and implementation of enterprise-wide HR solutions in the bank.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Welcome to the Requirements & Analysis team in People Technology. People Technology is a technology unit in Nordea Technology with the purpose to deliver technology services to employees in collaboration with our HR stakeholders and to drive simplification of our application landscape in the HR area.
   

  

 Working in People Technology you will find a positive and collaborative work environment with great opportunities to contribute and grow with your team but also in the wider value chain.
   

  

 As the SAP Integration Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and supporting integration solutions using SAP integration suite tools & technologies. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable and efficient integration solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Integration Suite with a deep understanding of integration patterns and best practices.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders and technical teams to understand integration requirements and design scalable and efficient integration solutions
* Design and develop integration solutions using SAP Integration Suite tools, including SAP Cloud Integration, SAP Process Integration (pi), and SAP API management
* Develop and maintain technical documentation related to system integration
* Provide technical guidance and support to developers and other team members
* Investigate and fix technical problems with system integration
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in SAP Integration Suite and related technologies and evaluate their potential for enhancing our integration capabilities
* Take part in quality control tasks such as code reviews
* Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement those improvements
* Communicate effectively with team members, clients, and other stakeholders
* Work closely with project managers and stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of integration solutions


 You’ll join a team where people are the most important and work is not only a place to go. We take pride in what we do, prioritize a learning culture and strive to have fun in our daily work. The role is based in Stockholm; Gdansk; Warsaw with a hybrid model of working. This is a permanent full-time role.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you are/have:**
* Business and technical background
* Great analytical and requirement specification skills
* Proactive, detail-oriented and quality driven
* Proven problem solving skills
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to bridge the gap between technical teams and non-technical HR stakeholders


**Your experience and background:**
* Have business and technical background
* Have great analytical and requirement specification skills
* Being proactive, detail-oriented and quality driven
* Have proven problem solving skills
* Have excellent communication skills with the ability to bridge the gap between technical teams and non-technical HR stakeholders
* Strong knowledge of integration patterns, best practices, and industry standards
* Hands-on experience designing, implementing, and supporting integration solutions using SAP Cloud Platform Integration tools
* Experience with JavaScript/Groovy or any other OOP languages
* Strong experience with integration: SAP Integration Development Guidelines, Performance Optimization Guidelines, Transaction Handling Guidelines, Operational Guidelines, Monitoring/Tracing/Alerting
* Strong understanding of RESTful and SOAP API design and troubleshooting
* Familiarity with data transformation tools (e.g., XSLT, JSON, XML) and ETL processes
* Experience and understanding of SAP SuccessFactors data model and entities
* DevOps mindset – inherent sense of ownership through deployment lifecycle
* Experience in working in HR domain and with HR system implementations
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration


**Additionally, familiarity with some of the below would be an advantage:**
* Experience in SAP products like SuccessFactors, HCM and FI/CO
* Hands-on experience with API development, middleware solutions, and integration platforms (e.g. MuleSoft, Dell Boomi, Workato)
* Experience or knowledge of SQL, Data Mapping, Data Migration and Process Modelling is an advantage
* Understanding of Data Architecture and different Integration Patterns


**What We Offer**
 Our team is a unique combination of different skillsets; some are more technically-oriented to work with sophisticated data diagrams and others have stronger facilitating skills for coaching. You’ll join a team where people are the most important and work is not only a place to go.
   

  

 We take pride in what we do, prioritize a learning culture and strive to have fun in our daily work. We have a strong business and employee experience focus and actively engage with delivery partners to deliver value through technology. Working in People Technology you will find a positive and collaborative work environment with great opportunities to contribute and grow with your team but also in the wider value chain.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 28/02/2025.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
   

  

**For candidates from Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**For candidates from Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf .
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Power BI Data Warehouse Analyst
description:
### **Mission:**


Plays a pivotal role in managing and optimizing data storage systems. Expertise will empower organizations to make informed decisions by providing efficient data retrieval, reporting, and analysis.

### **Place in the Organization:**

#### **Job Description:**
**GENERAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Collaborate with Business, Data Architects, and Data Modelers to translate business rules into technical requirements for the Incorta Unified Data & Analytics Platform
* Create SQL queries, scripts, and test data for System Integration Testing
* Perform data integration from various sources using Incorta’s Data Mapping Technology. (This utilizes the No-ETL Approach used within Incorta)
* Ensure data quality, load metrics, and adherence to data mapping rules
* Ensure data quality and load metrics
* Provide training and consultation to the Business for report writing
* Provide production support for the Data Warehouse
* Proactively solve data-related challenges
* Provide technical expertise to drive effective Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse (BI/DW) strategies

### **Contacts (Internal / external):**

* All internal departments within EMEA organization.
* Be a part of the SAP team both in Europe and US.
* Consultants in various countries.

### **Skills & Qualification:**

#### **Experience:**

* 3-5 years related field work experience
* Certifications such as Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst

#### **Technical Skills:**

* Proficiency in SQL.
* Familiarity with Parquet files.
* Familiarity with cloud computing (e.g., AWS), relational databases, and data warehousing
* Experience with Incorta Data Warehouse is ideal
* Experience with reporting tools (Power BI)
* Scripting skills (Python)
* Prior experience working with JD Edwards EnterpriseOne, SAP S4/Hana or SAP ECC6

#### **Education:**

* A relevant degree (Bachelor’s) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business

#### **Languages:**

* English

#### **Competencies:**

* Ability to meet objectives by influencing and engaging others across multiple teams.
* Quality and cost driven.

title: Software Test Architect - Evinova
description:
Transform billions of patients’ lives through technology, data, and cutting-edge ways of working. You’re disruptive, decisive, and transformative. Someone excited to use technology to improve patients’ health. We’re building a new Health-tech business – Evinova, a fully-owned subsidiary of AstraZeneca Group.


We’re not just building software—we’re transforming lives. If you’re passionate about leadership, collaboration, and driving innovation in healthcare, we’d love to have you join our team as a **Software** **T****est Architect**.


The **Product Engineering organization** consists of several self-organized/managed cross-functional teams with the people and skills needed to deliver our innovative digital products and solutions to patients and healthcare providers participating in clinical trials around the world. We are working with agile methodology delivering a new release of the software product with program increments every quarter.


We are proud to have one of the best software development teams you can find with deep technical and business skills to shape the product from early ideas and requirements through full implementation and support. This is a place where you can grow and learn together with other people delivering software with a great purpose.

 **What** **You’ll** **Be Doing**  

As a Software Test Architect, you will:

* **Define and Lead Testing Strategy**:  

Develop and own the end-to-end testing strategy for cloud-native applications, addressing **efficiency**, **quality**, **developer experience**, and **automation**.
* **Implement Technical Testing Capabilities**:  

Design and implement robust, scalable, and secure testing frameworks and tools that support a wide range of testing types, including:
* Functional Testing
* Non-Functional Testing
* Performance Testing
* Unit Testing
* Integration Testing
* Regression Testing
* **Automation First Approach**:  

Drive automation across all testing processes to enhance efficiency and reliability. Collaborate with development teams to integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipelines.
* **Ensure Compliance in a Regulated Environment**:  

Develop testing solutions that adhere to regulatory standards such as:
* **GxP** **(Good Clinical Practice)**
* **Software as a Medical Device (****SaMD****)**
* **HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act)**
* Other relevant regulatory frameworks.
* **Collaborate Across Teams**:  

Partner closely with developers, business analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure testing aligns with project requirements and business goals. Advocate for best practices in testing and quality assurance.
* **Optimize** **Developer Experience**:  

Enhance the developer experience by providing seamless and efficient testing processes, tools, and frameworks.
**Required Skills and Experience**

* Proven experience as a Test Architect or similar role, with a focus on cloud-native application testing.
* Expertise in designing and implementing testing frameworks and strategies for both frontend and backend systems.
* Strong knowledge of test tools and frameworks (e.g., Cucumber, Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, JUnit, etc.) and CI/CD pipelines.
* Proficiency in a variety of testing types, including functional, non-functional, performance, and integration testing.
* Strong programming or scripting skills (e.g., Python, Java, JavaScript, etc.).
* Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
* Cloud platform experience (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Strong experience working with and understanding both product requirements and test traceability to these requirements.
* Fluency in English is required
**Desired Skills and Experience**

* Hands-on experience in regulated environments, with knowledge of GxP, SaMD, HIPAA, or equivalent standards.
* Knowledge or experience with AI/ML testing frameworks.
* Experience with performance testing tools such as Grafana K6, Gatling, or similar.
**Why** **Evinova****?**  

Evinova draws on AstraZeneca’s deep experience developing novel therapeutics, informed by insights from thousands of patients and clinical researchers. Together, we can accelerate the delivery of life-changing medicines, improve the design and delivery of clinical trials for better patient experiences and outcomes, and think more holistically about patient care before, during, and after treatment. We know that regulators, healthcare professionals, and care teams at clinical trial sites do not want a fragmented approach. They do not want a future where every pharmaceutical company provides its own, different digital solutions. They want solutions that work across the sector, simplify their workload, and benefit patients broadly. By bringing our solutions to the wider healthcare community, we can help build more unified approaches to how we all develop and deploy digital technologies, better serving our teams, physicians, and ultimately patients. Evinova represents a unique opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes with digital and AI to serve the wider healthcare community and create new standards for the sector.

 **Location**  

This role is based in Gothenburg, with an on-site commitment of three days a week

**Join Us**  

Are you ready to make a real difference in the healthcare space? Apply now and become a part of Evinova’s innovative journey to transform clinical trials.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**Vill du utvecklas inom IT-arkitektur och lockas av en senior roll där du får ta helhetsansvar för hela Smartsigns molntjänster? Vill du arbeta på ett produktbolag och få möjlighet att både påverka och följa produktens utveckling över tid? Då kanske det är dig vi söker till rollen som Cloud Architect hos framgångsrika och lönsamma Smartsign! Här får du arbeta med att utveckla mjukvara för digital signage som mer än 4000** **företag** **världen över använder dagligen.**

**Välkommen till ett företag där tekniken är högprioriterad!**

**Om tjänsten**  

Som Cloud Architect hos oss får du en senior och flexibel roll med ansvar för att designa och implementera cloud-lösningar. I samråd med Tech lead och CTO utformar du och tar arkitektoniskt fram de målbilder och IT-lösningar som krävs för att vi ska kunna fortsätta utveckla våra produkter. Du fungerar också som ett stöd till våra utvecklingsteam och det är viktigt att du håller dig uppdaterad inom ditt område.


Du arbetar agilt med innovativa projekt i en kreativ miljö i nära och långsiktigt samarbete med kunder över hela världen, vilket både är utmanande och utvecklande. Självklart har vi en toppmodern teknikstack.


Vi månar om våra anställda och deras välmående. Vi erbjuder därför en stor flexibilitet i att kombinera arbete på kontoret med hemarbete, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och tjänstepension.


**Vem söker vi?**

Vi söker dig som i grunden har en högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande. Vidare har du minst 4 års erfarenhet av molntjänster och det är en stor fördel om du har erfarenhet från Azure. Kanske har du arbetat i större team eller varit ansvarig för vissa delar inom molntjänster och nu känner dig redo att axla ett helhetsansvar.


Du har erfarenhet av Docker, Kubernetes och Terraform. Det är fördelaktigt om du också har erfarenhet inom Node.js, C# och .NET. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


Som person är du noggrann och strukturerad. Du tar ansvar för ditt eget arbete och kan ta ägarskap i projekt från början till slut. Du är metodisk, proaktiv och har ett helhetsperspektiv samtidigt som du har ett öga för detaljer.


**Övrig information**


Tjänsten är på heltid, tillsvidare med tillträde enligt överenskommelse.


Du är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Borlänge som ligger centralt med bra pendlingsläge, men du kan självklart kombinera det med distansarbete. Annan placeringsort kan diskuteras.


Rekryteringen sker löpande, välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!


**Krav**

* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av molntjänster
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform

**Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet från Azure
* Node.js, C# och .NET

title: Tech Lead to our team Payment Platform
description:
**At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be.**


The Payments Platform Team is a backend heavy team that is responsible for the Payment Transactions, integration with our Payment Service Providers and Settlements Consolidation for our merchants. We stand on the transactional frontline, driven by an unwavering commitment to exceptional availability and performance levels.

 **Current focus for your team:**


Handles 50,000+ payment transactions per day  

On a journey from monolith to autonomy, and from on premise to cloud in AWS  

C#, .NET, AWS, Terraform, GitLab, Event Driven Architecture, RabbitMQ, MS SQL Server, New Relic, Kibana

 **Your focus will be to:**


You will lead the design of technical solutions aligned with our overarching strategies and guide your team's development activities by assisting in breaking down tasks and estimate efforts needed to reach your goals. You will divide your time between leading the team as well as doing hands on coding.


You will ensure that the team's solutions adhere to Qliro’s guidelines and meet regulatory and security standards and implement tactics to improve and maintain code quality.


Communicate the product team’s target architecture and vision to the team as well as supporting the Product Manager with your team's technical perspectives in their discovery, planning and stakeholder management.


You will mentor less experienced team members by providing constructive feedback as well as collaborate with our Engineering Manager to further develop the team's competence.


As a tech lead at Qliro, you are also a part of out extended leadership team where you will discuss strategies with leaders across Qliro in order to further redefine what Qliro and Payments can be.


**What we are looking for in our new team lead:**


‍You are highly experienced in C# .NET and have touched the majority of tools in the rest of the stack


‍️ Leadership skills to inspire and guide the team in the transition to a modern architecture prepared for Qliro’s current and future business needs



You have practical experience from working with agile engineering methods combined with a solid understanding of software engineering best practices

  

️ Since we are doing a cloud journey, migrating to AWS from on prem solutions, it is considered a plus if you have worked with cloud technologies

  

You have an understanding of system design, data structures, API development and algorithms


If you have worked with payment transactions before, it is highly beneficial

**If this sounds like you, we would really like to get in touch - please apply below!**

title: Facilities Technician, (Eskilstuna)
description:
• Experience operating electrical or mechanical systems in a mission critical environment.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office products, web-based operational tools, Change Management Systems (CMS) and Ticket Systems.
• Valid Driving License.
  

We are looking for a Facilities Technician to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. 
Facilities Technician is a hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operation responder.
 If you like to use apply your electrical and mechanical skills to solve problems, we’d like to meet you. Your work will help to maintain one of the world's largest information system infrastructures.
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
Key job responsibilities
The Facilities Technician will be in charge of, 
 o Assisting in the operation and maintenance of all electrical, mechanical, fire/life safety equipment and HVAC equipment within the Data Center/Facility. This equipment supports mission-critical servers and must maintain better than 99.999% uptime.
 o Assisting in the maintenance and monitoring of all Data Center systems to include incidents/events, problems, changes, monitoring, problem escalation/notification/resolution and all other aspects of Data Center support.
 o Monitoring and troubleshooting all mechanical, electrical, HVAC systems, voice/data, cooling systems, fire/life safety equipment and generators.
 o Providing assistance to contractor or data center engineers to ensure proper operation and maintenance of all facility equipment.
 o Providing assistance to contractors or data center engineers to deploy new equipment, such as building racks, cabling, and other tasks as necessary.
 o Performing site walk throughs to verify proper operation of Facility Equipment and Monitoring Systems.
 o Safety : Follow and maintain the highest safety standards and diligently encourage a world-class safety culture. As a facility owner team, ensure remediation of safety risks/issues in conjunction with other teams. Own the safety initiatives and projects to foster strong safety culture.
The Facilities Technician role involves covering 24x7 shift rotation.
A day in the life
 o Monitoring of all alarms and systems involved in the operation of power, cooling and fire suppression systems in the data center. 
 o Planning and coordinating vendor works on site to ensure equipment is maintained and uptime retained. 
 o Supporting other sites and teams during events and planned works. 
 o Carrying out rack power up and installation duties. 
 o Monitoring and facilitating new equipment handover. 
 o Supporting new hires and team members through knowledge share and development. 
 o Event response and drill participation.
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

* Data Center engineering experience
* Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant discipline
* Familiar with Building Management System (BMS) and Electrical Power Monitoring System (EPMS) control systems and data collection/trending.
* Good command of English

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Senior Technical Engineer - Store Payments
description:
**Job Description** **About the team:**  

The Store Payments Enablement team is a key part of H&M’s Business Tech organization, operating within the Product Development & Engineering Center. Our mission is to deliver secure, modular payment solutions that balance cost efficiency with competitive time-to-market delivery. As a global team, we support card and alternative payment methods across all H&M stores, brands, and markets.


Led by a dedicated Product Manager, our vision is to enable fast, secure, and frictionless payments. Driven by a passion for payment technology, we deliver best-in-class services for our customers and stakeholders.  

  

**About the role:**  

As a Senior Technical Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, configuration, and development of new payment technologies to be introduced at H&M. You will work with a variety of payment technologies, including collaborating closely with Payment Service Providers, to deliver innovative, scalable, and secure solutions that enhance the in-store payment experience for our customers.


Collaboration is central to this role. You will partner with teams across the organization, including those responsible for customer experience, core platform technology, technical infrastructure, and IT operations. Additionally, you will engage with Treasury, Cyber Security, Procurement, and Regional Teams to ensure alignment and integration of payment solutions with H&M’s broader business and operational objectives.


In your role, you will combine your technical engineering expertise with deep business knowledge to design, develop, and integrate complex systems—both from vendors and in-house. You will support the full lifecycle of payment technologies, focusing on accessibility, optimization, and security. Your work will ensure the delivery of reliable, mission-critical solutions that create value for H&M's customers and the business, while continuously driving improvements to meet evolving needs.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Technical Expertise & Vendor Collaboration:** Act as a technical advisor in commercial negotiations, procurement, and escalations with Payment Service Providers (PSPs), Point-of-Sale (POS) vendors, and other partners.
* **Requirements Gathering & Documentation:** Capture and document both functional and non-functional requirements in collaboration with Business Experts, Retail Project Leads, Regional Teams and other stakeholders to ensure global and local needs are met.
* **Development & Integration:** Ensure the implementation, configuration, and integration of payment solutions with POS systems, PSPs, and internal platforms, supporting both legacy modernization and new technology adoption.
* **Testing & Quality Assurance:** Design, test, and validate payment solutions, maintaining test environments with payment terminals, networks, and integrations to support stability, scalability, and security.
* **Problem Management:** Identify, analyze, and resolve payment-related issues, including root-cause analysis of larger payment related problems in partnership with vendors and relevant stakeholders.
* **Security & Compliance:** Ensure all payment solutions adhere to PCI-DSS, GDPR, ISO, and other security and regulatory requirements, maintaining a secure and compliant payment environment.
* **Technical Leadership & Knowledge Sharing:** Serve as the team's technical subject matter expert, producing documentation, and driving best practices in system performance, automation, and analytics.
* **Project & Stakeholder Engagement:** Drive technical projects from inception to completion, engage with management and other key stakeholders on progress and achievements, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to maximize business value.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Complex problem-solving skills with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.
* Deep expertise in payment technologies and processes.
* Experience in designing platform architectures based on the latest payment technologies and innovations.
* Ability to work on technology-agnostic, high-performing, secure payment solutions that meet customer needs.
* Proficient in user testing, including automated testing, test case creation and deployment of technical solutions.
* Understanding of networking principles relevant to payment systems.
* Experience in researching and applying emerging payment trends in design, architecture, and engineering
* Strong knowledge of security best practices and compliance requirements (e.g., PCI-DSS, GDPR).
* Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams.
* Proven informal leadership skills, including managing dependencies and cross-team coordination with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Some project management experience, including tracking, reporting, risk management, and issue resolution is an advantage
* Familiarity with cloud technologies and cloud-based payment solutions is an advantage

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is **based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden**.  

Apply by sending in your **CV in English** as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.

**Benefits**


We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

**Inclusion & Diversity**


At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

**Company Description**


H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: H&M Summer Internship – Software Engineering
description:
**Company Description**  

Curious about what it’s like to work with technology at H&M? Are you eager to get hands-on experience and turn your theoretical knowledge into practical skills? If you are intrigued by how one of the world’s largest fashion brands operates and how technology drives innovation, then this opportunity is for you!


As a Software Engineering Intern at H&M Business Tech, you will spend 10 weeks gaining real-world experience while working on live projects within our software engineering teams. You will work alongside experienced engineers and tech experts, contributing to applications, central tools for tech governance, and business-critical solutions. Additionally, this internship provides an excellent networking opportunity, allowing you to collaborate with colleagues across the company and connect with interns from other programs to explore the versatility of our business.


During the internship, you will be paired with a mentor who will play a key role in your learning journey, offering guidance, support, and training opportunities. You will also have a network of experienced colleagues ready to help you develop your technical skills and deepen your understanding of software development in a global fashion-tech company.


This is your chance to launch a stellar career and help us transform the fashion world. Let’s shape the future together!

 **Job Description** **What you’ll be doing:**


As a Software Engineering Intern, your experience will be a mix of hands-on development work, mentorship, and structured learning opportunities. You will:

* Contribute to real projects – Help design, develop, test, and maintain high-quality software solutions
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams – Work with engineers, data scientists, and designers to build innovative tech products
* Learn from experienced engineers – Participate in code reviews, troubleshooting, and debugging sessions
* Gain exposure to modern development tools – Work with agile methodologies, cloud platforms, and industry-standard tools
* Explore new technologies – Stay up to date with emerging trends and best practices in software engineering

**What you’ll be learning:**


Throughout the internship, you’ll be given opportunities to:

* Gain hands-on experience working with multi - cloud environment (Azure & GCP), and improve your coding skills (we work with programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, Go/Golang, YAML, Java and .NET)
* Develop problem-solving skills through real-world challenges and collaboration with your team
* Learn internal tools and best practices, including version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, automating and streamlining the software development lifecycle
* Receive structured learning opportunities, including relevant training sessions on modern software practices and industry tools
* Enhance your professional development with mentorship and career-building guidance from experienced tech leaders

  

**Qualifications**  

To be successful in the role, we believe that you:

* Are currently enrolled in a university program (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, or related field) in the later stages of your academic career and will have coursework remaining after completing this internship (preferably 2nd year of Bachelor’s or 1st year of Master’s)
* Have basic knowledge of software development principles, algorithms, and data structures
* Have experience with one or more programming languages (Java, .NET, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
* Are familiar with version control systems (Git, GitHub)
* A curious problem-solver eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
* Are fluent in English, both written and verbal and with excellent communication skills

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a full-time internship located in Stockholm. We are looking for someone to start from 17th June for 10 weeks.

**Good to know – Application & Practical Information**


Excited to join us? Then please get in touch. The last day to apply is 2nd of March. Due to GDPR we can only handle applications via our career site. Send us your application in English including a resume and proof of education.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

**Benefits**


This is a paid internship program, meaning you will work full-time and receive a market-based salary. Other H&M Group benefits will be shared later in the process. This position requires a valid permit to live and work in Sweden.

**Recruitment Process & Timeline**


When you apply for a Software Engineer internship role, we will have the following steps in the process:

* **Screening questions:** when you apply, you will be asked to answer a few short questions to assess your eligibility for the role.
* **Online assessment:** you will be asked to complete an online analytical assessment, between 3-7th March.
* **Virtual Assessment Center:** if successful, you will be invited to a one-day assessment center, taking place between 18-25th March.
* **Final decision:** our goal is to be able to let you know the outcome of the assessment center before 6th April.

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*

**Company Description**


H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Team Lead Aquisition & Growth - vikariat
description:
På Tre är vi fokuserade på att driva tillväxt! Vi är en av Sveriges största telekomaktörer och utmanare på marknaden. 2024 var ett spännande år, och vi ser fram emot 2025 med ännu större ambitioner! Nu söker vi en driven ledare för att leda vårt team Acquisition & Growth, som arbetar med tillväxt mot konsumentmarknaden.
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

Som Team Lead Acquisition & Growth leder du ett team på 5 personer med ansvar för att växa och utveckla vår kundbas, både kortsiktigt via kampanjer och långsiktigt genom kundupplevelse. Du arbetar med konkurrenskraftiga erbjudanden, driver nya initiativ och förbättrar kundresan. Med analyser och insikter skapar du strategier för att minska churn och stärka kundrelationer.
  
  

Du ingår i ledningsgruppen för vår kommersiella enhet och driver den kommersiella agendan mot vår CCO och VD. Rollen innebär många kontaktytor internt, och ditt team leder beslutsmöten med både CFO och VD. Tjänsten är ett vikariat på cirka ett år med start den 1 april, men vi är flexibla kring startdatum.
  
  

Och som ledare...
  
…är din viktigaste uppgift att stärka vår kultur. Vi tror på att trygghet i teamen leder till innovation och framgång. Hos oss får du leda i en dynamisk miljö där vi provar, utvärderar och utvecklar.
  
  

Du kan se fram emot att
  
  

Ha en central roll i att utmana telekommarknaden.
  
Utvecklas i din ledarroll och inspirera andra genom ditt driv.
  
Jobba på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser (jajamen, även 2025 har vi blivit utsedda till en av de bästa hos Great place to work)!
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är målmedveten, datadriven och skicklig på att kommunicera och driva förändring. Du har förmågan att samarbeta tvärfunktionellt och du jobbar hela tiden med att driva kommersiella resultat. Du trivs i en föränderlig miljö där du får coacha och utveckla både människor och affärer och kommer att axla din ledarroll med engagemang.
  
  

Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av att jobba med kundupplevelse, affärsutveckling och projektledning från kommersiella verksamheter.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på några frågor vi ställer i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat.
  
  

Välkommen till Tre!
  
  

Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
  
  

Friskvårdsbidrag, föräldrarlön, pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal
  
  

Flexibla helgdagar och fem dagar extra ledigt per år
  
  

Hundzon & gym i 3huset
  
  

Subventionerad lunch
  
  

Förmånliga rabatter på cyklar, kollektivtrafik och elbilar
  
  

Generösa bonusmodeller eller provisioner
  
  

Vi drivs av att hela tiden försöka göra saker bättre, på nya och annorlunda sätt. Vi ser oss själva som en avgörande del av Sveriges samhällsstruktur, eftersom vi vet att pålitlig uppkoppling är en viktig grundsten i dagens digitala värld.
  
  

Tre föddes som utmanare och är en organisation i ständig rörelse. Vi strävar efter att vara i framkant i allt vi gör. Vi är övertygade om att det är människorna och kulturen på Tre som är avgörande för vår utveckling.
  
  

När du startar din resa på Tre finns det oändliga möjligheter att växa och utvecklas med oss.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - I en föränderlig värld, är vi på Tre nyfikna och ständigt öppna för nya lösningar. På Tre anpassar vi vägen framåt allt eftersom vi provar och lär oss vad som funkar bäst.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - På Tre gör vi alltid vårt bästa. Vi känner ägandeskap för vår uppgift, sätter tydliga mål och håller fokus på det som gör mest nytta för affären.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - På Tre är vi schyssta kollegor. Vi samarbetar med varandra över team och funktioner, vi bollar idéer, ger och tar emot feedback.
  
  

2003
  
Tre först i Sverige med videosamtal och strömning av mobil video. Att se personen som du ringer upp i ögonen är en helt ny upplevelse vid den här tidpunkten.
  
  

2006
  
Tre lanserar mobilt bredband som tredje operatör i världen. Under de kommande fem åren vinner Tre pris för Sveriges snabbaste mobila bredband.
  
  

2013
  
Tre’s systerbolag Hallon startas med en vision att vara den enkla mobiloperatören utan onödigt krångel.
  
  

2019
  
Ett händelserikt år! 3Världen lanseras som innebär att kunder kan surfa i 80 länder till samma pris som inom Sverige. Därefter lanseras 3Samla som gör att alla kunder kan lägga till fler användare till sitt abonnemang och sist men inte minst är Tre först i Sverige med ett lansera ett publikt 5G-nät.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena byter från 1 januari namn till 3Arena. Med vår starka passion för innovation, uppkoppling och upplevelser ska vi medverka till arenans och områdets utveckling.
  
  

Christian Sundgren | Kontaktperson

title: Facilities Technician, (Eskilstuna)
description:
• Experience operating electrical or mechanical systems in a mission critical environment.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office products, web-based operational tools, Change Management Systems (CMS) and Ticket Systems.
• Valid Driving License.
  

We are looking for a Facilities Technician to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. 
Facilities Technician is a hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operation responder.
 If you like to use apply your electrical and mechanical skills to solve problems, we’d like to meet you. Your work will help to maintain one of the world's largest information system infrastructures.
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
Key job responsibilities
The Facilities Technician will be in charge of, 
 o Assisting in the operation and maintenance of all electrical, mechanical, fire/life safety equipment and HVAC equipment within the Data Center/Facility. This equipment supports mission-critical servers and must maintain better than 99.999% uptime.
 o Assisting in the maintenance and monitoring of all Data Center systems to include incidents/events, problems, changes, monitoring, problem escalation/notification/resolution and all other aspects of Data Center support.
 o Monitoring and troubleshooting all mechanical, electrical, HVAC systems, voice/data, cooling systems, fire/life safety equipment and generators.
 o Providing assistance to contractor or data center engineers to ensure proper operation and maintenance of all facility equipment.
 o Providing assistance to contractors or data center engineers to deploy new equipment, such as building racks, cabling, and other tasks as necessary.
 o Performing site walk throughs to verify proper operation of Facility Equipment and Monitoring Systems.
 o Safety : Follow and maintain the highest safety standards and diligently encourage a world-class safety culture. As a facility owner team, ensure remediation of safety risks/issues in conjunction with other teams. Own the safety initiatives and projects to foster strong safety culture.
The Facilities Technician role involves covering 24x7 shift rotation.
A day in the life
 o Monitoring of all alarms and systems involved in the operation of power, cooling and fire suppression systems in the data center. 
 o Planning and coordinating vendor works on site to ensure equipment is maintained and uptime retained. 
 o Supporting other sites and teams during events and planned works. 
 o Carrying out rack power up and installation duties. 
 o Monitoring and facilitating new equipment handover. 
 o Supporting new hires and team members through knowledge share and development. 
 o Event response and drill participation.
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

* Data Center engineering experience
* Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant discipline
* Familiar with Building Management System (BMS) and Electrical Power Monitoring System (EPMS) control systems and data collection/trending.
* Good command of English

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
